intro: Alchemilla nyikensis, commonly known as the Nyiké alkanet, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features basal leaves that are palmately lobed and covered in a dense layer of fine, silky hairs. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Alchemilla nyikensis is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
